title: Job Vacancies at Neptune Microfinance Bank
content:
Neptune is on a mission to empower people through financial intermediation in Nigeria and Africa. We are poised to meet your business and personal financial needs.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head of Agent & Merchant Business (POS)

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Head of Agent & Merchant Business (POS) is responsible for driving the bank’s POS acquiring, merchant payments, and agency banking operations.
	This role oversees the full lifecycle of POS and agent networks from strategy and deployment to revenue growth, operational performance, compliance, and risk management, ensuring nationwide coverage, high transaction volumes, strong liquidity, and minimal downtime.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute national POS and merchant acquisition strategies across SMEs, retail, fuel stations, transport hubs, and informal markets.
	Define commercial models (MDR, terminal fees, settlement pricing, incentives) and manage the P&L for the POS and agent business.
	Recruit, onboard, and manage agents across tiers; ensure liquidity and float availability.
	Oversee POS terminal deployment, activation, maintenance, and vendor relationships; monitor uptime, transaction volumes, and service reliability
	Onboard, train, and activate merchants; optimize transaction throughput, revenue per terminal, and reduce dormancy.
	Manage settlements, chargebacks, disputes, and fraud prevention; ensure compliance with CBN, KYC/AML, and consumer protection standards.
	Drive revenue across POS fees, transfers, cash-in/out, bill payments, USSD, and QR; track and optimize performance metrics.
	Collaborate on POS software upgrades, QR payments, dashboards, and reconciliation systems; implement real-time monitoring tools.
	Lead nationwide field, merchant, and agent teams, ensuring operational excellence through SOPs, dashboards, and performance tracking.


KPIs


	Active POS terminals and transaction volume/value
	Revenue per terminal/merchant
	Terminal uptime and failure rates
	Fraud/chargeback ratios
	Agent/merchant activation and retention
	Float liquidity sufficiency
	Operational cost efficiency


Key Skills & Competencies


	Expertise in POS acquiring, agency banking, settlement operations, and merchant payments.
	Experience with NIBSS, PTSPs, payment gateways, and switching platforms.
	Strong analytical, commercial, and negotiation skills.
	Leadership of distributed teams and field operations.
	Understanding of regulatory frameworks, KYC/AML, and financial inclusion policies.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: recruitmentnmfb@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Corporate Banking Marketing Executive

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking a Corporate Banking Marketing Executive who is a senior executive responsible for driving the bank’s business with medium, and large-sized corporates, multinationals, and institutional clients.
	The role oversees corporate lending, deposits, trade finance, treasury sales, relationships, and strategic sector growth.
	This leader ensures the bank captures high-value clients, deepens wallets, manages risk, and grows the bank’s corporate portfolio profitably.


Core Responsibilities


	Define and execute the bank’s corporate banking strategy across key sectors (FMCG, Oil & Gas, Manufacturing, Telecoms, Construction, Government, Logistics, Energy, Import/Export).
	Develop tailored value propositions, product bundles, and solutions for corporate clients to drive acquisition and market penetration.
	Lead corporate relationship managers, sector heads, and business development teams, fostering a high-performance culture with clear KPIs.
	Oversee end-to-end corporate account management: onboarding, KYC, documentation, credit structuring, loan packaging, financial analysis, and renewals.
	Ensure customer satisfaction, increased wallet share, and long-term retention.
	Manage credit risk, asset quality, NPLs, and adherence to CBN regulations, internal credit policies, and risk frameworks.
	Grow revenue from corporate loans (term, working capital, overdraft), deposits (current, call, fixed), and payments/collections (cash management, payroll, POS, gateways).
	Identify cross-sell opportunities across SME, Treasury, Digital Banking, and Payments units.
	Monitor portfolio profitability, yield, sector performance, and identify high-growth markets for expansion.
	Train staff on credit structuring, relationship management, and product knowledge, ensuring strong team capability and compliance with AML/CFT and KYC standards.


KPIs (Performance Indicators)


	Loan portfolio growth
	Deposit mobilization (CASA & term deposits)
	Trade finance turnover and fees
	Revenue per corporate client
	Credit quality (NPL ratio)
	Client acquisition & retention
	Treasury cross-sell contribution
	Portfolio yield and profitability.


Key Skills & Competencies


	At least 3 years of experience working within the Financial Industry.
	Strong understanding of lending, credit structuring, risk management, and trade finance.
	In-depth knowledge of corporate business environments and financial markets.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills.
	Analytical capability for financial modeling and credit analysis.
	Leadership experience managing revenue-driven teams.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: recruitmentnmfb@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Head of Internal Control and Audit

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	We're looking for an experienced professional to lead our internal control and audit team in a microfinance institution.
	The ideal candidate will oversee daily transaction reviews, conduct customer verification checks, and investigate discrepancies to ensure our assets are safeguarded and regulatory standards are met.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily bank transaction reviews and auditing
	Conduct customer verification checks and staff checks
	Investigate discrepancies, cash suppression, or potential fraud cases
	Implement and maintain internal control checks
	Ensure policy compliance and regulatory requirements
	Prepare and submit reports on control activities and audit findings
	Supervise and mentor the internal control and audit team
	Assess potential risks and develop mitigation strategies


Requirements


	HND / Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Minimum 5 years of experience in internal control and audit, preferably in a microfinance institution or related field
	ACCA/ICAN or other related certification is an added advantage
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Excellent communication and leadership skills
	Proficiency in audit software and MS Office applications


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: recruitmentnmfb@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) Credit Administrative Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	The Credit Administrative Officer at Neptune Micro Finance Bank is responsible for supporting the credit control department by managing credit applications, maintaining accurate records, and ensuring compliance with lending policies.
	This role involves coordinating with clients and internal teams to facilitate the credit approval process, monitor loan disbursements, and assist in risk assessment and mitigation.


Responsibilities


	Review and process credit applications submitted by potential clients.
	Verify the accuracy and completeness of all documentation and information provided.
	Prepare and process loan disbursement documentation.
	Assist in conducting credit risk assessments by gathering and analyzing financial data.
	Prepare credit reports and summaries for review by senior credit officers and management.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all credit transactions and client interactions.
	Ensure all credit files are properly organized and stored in compliance with regulatory requirements.
	Prepare regular reports on credit activities and performance metrics.
	Ensure all credit activities comply with internal policies and external regulatory requirements. 


Requirements


	BSc / HND in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in credit administration, loan processing, or a related role in the financial services industry.
	Strong understanding of credit processes and risk assessment.
	Excellent organizational and record-keeping skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office  (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: recruitmentnmfb@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Social Media Manager Job at SAHA Africa




        
    

        
        At SAHA Africa, we are dedicated to elevating the hospitality industry by connecting businesses with top-tier talent and providing comprehensive training for hospitality professionals. With years of experience in the industry, we specialize in recruitment services that help hotels, restaurants, and hospitality establishments find skilled and passionate staff. Our extensive network and deep understanding of the sector ensure that we match the right talent with the right opportunities, helping businesses thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Requirements
     

            
    




	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@sahaafrica.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
